alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 03 at 11:17PM AKST until January 04 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES FOR THE FAR NORTHERN PANHANDLE... Our current system is tracking north across the Panhandle, with snow falling over the far north. Various reports of upwards of 6 to 8 inches snow for the Haines and Chilkat Peninsula area have been received as of 11 pm Wednesday with snow still falling moderately. As warmer air aloft is still expected to move into the north by early Thursday morning we are still expecting a period of a wintry mix and/or freezing rain for Haines. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Haines Borough and Klukwan. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Reports of 6 to 8 inches of snow have been received around the Haines and Chilkat Peninsula area as of 11 pm Wednesday, with snow still falling moderately. Freezing rain may mix in for the town of Haines late Wednesday night and early Thursday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
